connector.description:
Send events to Azure Event Hubs.

The Kamelet checks for the `partition` / `ce-partition` header to determine how long an event remains in the Azure Storage queue. Use `PnDTnHnMn.nS.` format. For example, `PT20.345S` parses as 20.345 seconds and `P2D` parses as 2 days.
   
A header is optional. If the header is not set, the partition is assigned by Event Hubs.

camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-sink.share.name: camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-sink.sharedAccessName
camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-sink.share.description: The Event Hubs SAS key name.

camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-sink.share.name: camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-sink.sharedAccessKey
camel.kamelet.azure-eventhubs-sink.share.description: The key for the Event Hubs SAS key name.
